page.title: 19Llandudno Ski Complex.
page.content: { A 700 foot dry ski slope,}second largest in Europe,{plus an artificial {toboggan run,}is proposed for the Gt. Orme. The greensward of Happy Valley would be used as a car park. After 14 months of talks, final approval has not been given. Some Town Councillors oppose the site of the car park as the land was given by the{Mostyn Family for the use of the people of Llandudno and, as such, should belong to{Llan- {dudno Town Council,}not to{Aberconwy {Boro' Council}who are discussing the development. The developers state that it would attract people from all over the North-West, over 100,000 skiers a year could be expected and the{British {Dry Ski Slope Championships}could be staged. Buses would carry most skiers from the car park to the slopes. An 800 name petition opposing the plan was received by the Town Mayor.
